s1.name: mindc documentation
s1.p: mindc is a modular and extensible architecture compilation tool-chain that can be used to compile component-based applications from their architectural descriptions (ADL files).

s2.name: User Guide
s2.p: The mindc User Guide gives a description of:

ul.li: the ADL and IDL languages used to describe the architecture of an application;
the coding conventions that must be followed in the C code,
the use of the mindc tool-chain.

s2.p: This document is available in multiple versions:

s2.name: Technical documentation
s2.p: The mindc Technical documentation contains various generated reports based on the mindc source code. It includes javadoc, highlighted source-code, test-coverage and various maven reports

s1.name: MindEd documentation
s1.p:
MindEd is an Eclipse-based IDE (Integrated Development Environment) for fractal MIND applications.
MindEd provides for ADL, IDL and CPL files :

ul.li: a textual editor with auto-completion, syntaxic and semantic coloring, Eclipse's quick-fix system among other features.
a specialised navigator to handle project exploration, which automatically manages paths and makefile.
a graphical editor for a visual representation and edition of mind's components.

s2.name: Technical documentation
s2.p: MindEd is an Eclipse plug-in created with three modeling frameworks (code generation facilities) developped by the Eclipse Project :

ul.li: Eclipse Modeling Framework (EMF) generates a structured data model (more info here)
Textual Modeling Framework (TMF Xtext) generates a text editor based on a given grammar (more info here)
Graphical Modeling Framework (GMF) generates a graphical editor based on and EMF metamodel, both for edition and visualisation (more info here)
